bibl.title: Gebel Asyut al-Gharbi in the First Millenium AD.
bibl.note: The Asyut Project. - Christian Gebel Asyut al-Gharbi [Deir el-Azzam; - Kom el-Shuqafa; - Deir el-Meitin; - J11.3 and G10.1; - Additional evidence of Christian occupation]. - Tombs II, III and IV [John of Lycopolis; - Barriers to interpretation: Use and reuse of Tombs II-IV (2nd millenium BC - 2nd millenium AD)]. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork

bibl.seg: Jochem Kahl, Gebel Asyut al-Gharbi in the First Millenium AD.

Elisabeth R. O'Connell (ed.), Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork = British Museum Publications on Egypt and Sudan. 2 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 127-138, 6 figg. et pll. 1-13.

The Asyut Project. - Christian Gebel Asyut al-Gharbi [Deir el-Azzam; - Kom el-Shuqafa; - Deir el-Meitin; - J11.3 and G10.1; - Additional evidence of Christian occupation]. - Tombs II, III and IV [John of Lycopolis; - Barriers to interpretation: Use and reuse of Tombs II-IV (2nd millenium BC - 2nd millenium AD)]. - Conclusion.
